msgSnippet: It s the way you are passing in some arguments.  The actual offense eludes me at this point and I have to leave right now.  I will post an answer tomorrow.

It's the way you are passing in some arguments.  The actual offense eludes
me at this point and I have to leave right now.  I will post an answer
tomorrow.

-Jason

    > -----Original Message-----
    > From: Paul Hodgetts [mailto:prh@...]
    > Sent: Thursday, June 14, 2001 5:32 PM
    > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
    > Subject: [junit] Little Help Please: Could not invoke the 
    > suite() method
    > Error
    > 
    > 
    > This is driving us nuts.  We're running our main test 
    > suite via the
    > junit.textui.TestRunner class.  We're getting an error "Could not
    > invoke the suite() method."
    > 
    > Our test class does indeed have a suite() method.  We think this
    > test suite did run at some point prior to some rework to our build
    > script (but we're not sure).
    > 
    > We thought it had to be a class path problem, but after staring at
    > it for a while, we can't see any class path problems.
    > 
    > Looking at the source code didn't help much, since it's just
    > catching any exception thrown out of the invoke call, we 
    > can't tell
    > specifically what the exception is.
    > 
    > What are the typical causes of this error message?  Any and all
    > suggestions greatly appreciated.
    > 
    > Thanks in advance,
    > -Paul
    >
